channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Australian PGA
item.description:
Sunday, 30 November 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate the Australian PGA

The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA’s flagship event. A stellar field of Australian and International players will compete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf’s oldest trophy. This tournament is for the fans and will feature a range of experiences and precincts for golf fans, families, and party goers alike.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Sunday, 30 November 2025

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate the Christmas in the City

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of free and low-cost Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family.
Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by the Queen Street Mall for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances.
For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: World AIDS Day
item.description:
Monday, 1 December 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Red to support World AIDS Day

World AIDS Day is held on 1 December each year globally and raises awareness across the world and in the community about the issues surrounding HIV and AIDS. It is a day for people to show their support for people living with HIV and to commemorate people who have been lost to the epidemic here in Queensland, and further afield.
Queensland Positive People (QPP), is a peer-led, community-based organisation committed to improving the lives of all people living with HIV and help reduce new transmissions of HIV and other STIs across Queensland. With the support of Queensland Health, QPP delivers the World AIDS Day awareness campaign in Queensland, and supports the Queensland Council of LGBTI Health to deliver the vigils and remembrances in Brisbane and across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Positive People Inc.

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Youngcare Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Tuesday, 2 December 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red to support Youngcare Christmas Appeal

Too many young people with complex physical disabilities are being left behind; living without the choice and equality that we all deserve. Youngcare is a national not-for-profit dedicated to ensuring all young people, regardless of their care needs can choose where they live, who they live with and how they live their lives. Youngcare is raising awareness and funds to achieve its mission, in the lead up to the International Day of Disabled Persons on 3rd of December, and further ahead to the Christmas Appeal.

This Light Up is organised by: YoungCare

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2025 International Day of People with Disability
item.description:
Wednesday, 3 December 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue, Green and Orange to support 2025 International Day of People with Disability

International Day of People with Disability is held on 3 December each year, and is a United Nations observed day aimed at increasing public awareness, understanding and acceptance of people with disability.
It's a day to celebrate the achievements and contributions of people with disability.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: World Chromosome 18 Day
item.description:
Thursday, 4 December 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple Yellow Green Pink to support World Chromosome 18 Day

World Chromosome 18 Day raises awareness to help Chromosome 18 Australasia achieve its objectives. The day also celebrates individuals affected and their families and brings much happiness to each of them. Join Chromosome 18 families from around the World on Sunday 7 December, for World Chromosome 18 Day! This is a free, virtual event with Educational speakers, research updates, Syndrome breakouts and Self-Advocate sessions. But most of all, it is a chance to come together with our global chromosome 18 families to learn, connect, and have fun! Pre-Registration is required at www.chromosome18.org

This Light Up is organised by: Chromosone 18 Australasia

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

But most of all, it is a chance to come together with our global chromosome 18 families to learn, connect, and have fun! Pre-Registration is required at www.chromosome18.org

This Light Up is organised by: Chromosone 18 Australasia

item.title: Ashes Test Cricket
item.description:
Friday, 5 December 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate Ashes Test Cricket

The Gabba will host its first ever day/night Ashes Test as Australia and England return to Brisbane for the 2nd of the 2025/26 NRMA Insurance Men's Ashes Series.
The Ashes remains one of the most historic events in world sport, with intense rivalries, unforgettable moments and world-class cricket in the battle for the iconic urn.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Decvelopment Agency

item.title: Christmas in the City
item.description:
Friday, 5 December 2025

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Christmas in the City

Brisbane comes alive this December with plenty of free and low-cost Christmas festivities ideal for the whole family.
Join us for the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, sing along to your favourite Christmas tunes at the Lord Mayor's Christmas Carols or drop by the Queen Street Mall for pop-up entertainment and roaming performances.
For more information about Christmas in the heart of Brisbane, visit the Visit Brisbane website.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Decvelopment Agency

item.title: Brisbane International
item.description:
Sunday, 4 January 2026

The Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Blue with Yellow to celebrate The Brisbane International

The Brisbane International presented by ANZ returns from 4-11 January 2026. The Brisbane International 2026 is set to deliver a full week of elite tennis and vibrant summer energy. With world-class tennis featuring the best players from the ATP and WTA tour and an electric atmosphere at the Queensland Tennis Centre, the summer of tennis begins in Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue with Yellow to celebrate The Brisbane International

The Brisbane International presented by ANZ returns from 4-11 January 2026. The Brisbane International 2026 is set to deliver a full week of elite tennis and vibrant summer energy. With world-class tennis featuring the best players from the ATP and WTA tour and an electric atmosphere at the Queensland Tennis Centre, the summer of tennis begins in Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
